{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2008â09 |Prev year=2007â08 |Next year=2009â10 |Team=Villanova Wildcats |Image= |Conference=Big East Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big East |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=30â8 |ConfRecord=13â5 |HeadCoach=[[Jay Wright (coach)|Jay Wright]] |AsstCoach1=[[Pat Chambers]] |AsstCoach2=[[Doug West]] |AsstCoach3=Jason Donnelly |StadiumArena=[[The Pavilion]] |Champion= |BowlTourney=[[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Men's Division I Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult=[[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|Final Four]] }} {{2008â09 Big East men's basketball standings}} The [[Villanova Wildcats men's basketball|Villanova Wildcats]] had a 22â13 (9â9) record in the 2008 season. Their season resulted in a trip to the Final Four, with their last second win over the Pittsburgh Panthers in the Elite 8.For the 2008â09 season, Villanova returned all but one from their entire roster that made it to the Sweet 16 of the NCAA Tournament. That squad with no seniors, lost 6 of 7 games during a 3-week span in the middle of the season, but came back to make the NCAA tournament. The 2008â09 schedule includes playing Texas in the Jimmy V. Classic, 18 [[Big East]] contests, competing in the Philly Hoops Group Classic (against Niagara, Monmouth, Townson and either Penn State or Rhode Island), and games against a trip to Albany, Fordham, Houston Baptist, & Navy. On December 1, 2008, Cassiem Drummond announced his intention to transfer out of the Villanova basketball team.http://nbcsports.msnbc.com/id/28002139/ ====Class of 2008==== [http://www.rivals.com/commitlist.asp?year=2008&sport=2&school=33 Villanova Class of 2008 â Rivals][http://kansas.scout.com/a.z?s=172&p=9&cfg=bb&c=8&yr=2008 Villanova Class of 2008 â Scout][http://insider.espn.go.com/ncb/recruiting/tracker/school?page=commits&season=2008&schoolId=2305 Villanova Class of 2008 â ESPN] {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=no|collapse=no|year=2008}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Maurice Sutton | position = C | hometown = Upper Marlboro, MD | highschool = Largo HS | feet = 6 | inches = 10 | weight = 190 | 40 = | commitdate = 2008-05-21 | scout stars = 3 | rivals stars = 3 | espn grade = 87 }} |- | colspan="7" style="padding-left:10px;" | '''Overall Recruiting Rankings:'''     [[Scout.com|Scout]] â '''NR'''     [[Rivals.com|Rivals]] â '''NR''' [http://villanova.rivals.com/content.asp?CID=1082109 2008 Team Recruiting Rankings â Rivals]     [[ESPN]] â '''NR'''  |} ==Roster== {| style="border:5px solid #000000;" cellspacing=8 |- align="center" bgcolor="darkblue" |colspan=6|'''Villanova Basketball'''
'''2008â09 Roster''' |- |G/F | align="right" |22 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |[[Dwayne Anderson]] |SR |Washington, DC (St. Thomas More) |- |F | align="right" |20 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |Shane Clark |SR |Philadelphia, PA (Hargrave Military Academy) |- |G | align="right" |4 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |Jason Colenda |SO |Fairfax, VA (Bishop O'Connell) |- |F | align="right" |33 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |[[Dante Cunningham]] |SR |Silver Spring, MD (Potomac) |- |G | align="right" |10 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |[[Corey Fisher]] |SO |Bronx, NY (St. Patrick's, NJ) |- |C | align="right" |3 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |Maurice Sutton |FR |Upper Marlboro, MD (Largo HS, MD) |- |F | align="right" |0 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |Antonio Pena |SO |Brooklyn, NY (St. Thomas More) |- |G | align="right" |15 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |Reggie Redding |JR |Philadelphia, PA (St. Joseph's Prep) |- |G | align="right" |1 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |[[Scottie Reynolds]] |JR |Herndon, VA (Herndon) |- |G | align="right" |24 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |[[Corey Stokes]] |SO |Bayonne, NJ (St. Benedict's) |- |F | align="right" |42 |[[Image:Flag of Cameroon.svg|20px]] |Frank Tchuisi |SR |Douala, Cameroon (St. Benedict's) |- |F | align="right" |23 |[[Image:Flag of the United States.svg|20px]] |Russell Wooten |JR |Chula Vista, California (St. Augustine) |} ==2008â2009 Season== Before the season began, on October 22, 2008, the Wildcats were selected to finish 5th among the 16 [[Big East]] Conference teams in the annual Preseason Coaches Poll at Madison Square Garden. Nova returned all five starters from a 22â13 squad that reached the Sweet 16 of the NCAA Tournament.http://villanova.cstv.com/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/102208aab.html As part of recent tradition, the 2008 Hoopsmania (an on-campus kickoff of the Villanova Basketball season), included a performance by hip-hop artist T-Pain. Previous artists have included 50 Cent, Tony Yayo and MIMS.[http://villanova.cstv.com/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/102408aae.html Hoopsmania Kickoff] The Villanova-Pitt game on January 28, 2009 was the last game to be held at the [[Wachovia Spectrum]] which drew a crowd of 17,449.http://villanova.cstv.com/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/020109aaa.html The Wildcats finished perfect this year at the Pavilion. Villanova's 25 regular-season wins tied a school record. It had been done three times before, but not since 1950â51. During the 2009 Big East Awards Ceremony, head coach [[Jay Wright (coach)|Jay Wright]] was named the 2009 Big East Coach of the Year. He has won the award twice during the past 4 years. Villanova senior forward Dante Cunningham was named the Big East's Most Improved Player, and sophomore guard Corey Fisher won the Sixth Man Award. All-Big East. Cunningham, a senior forward, won second-team honors on the all-Big East team, while junior guard Scottie Reynolds took honorable mention.http://www.philly.com/philly/sports/homepage/20090310_Villanovas_Jay_Wright_named_Big_East_Coach_of_the_Year.html Jay Wright Big East Coach of the Year . Accessed 2009-03-12. [http://www.webcitation.org/5hLPXgc3s Archived] 2009-06-06. ==2009 Big East Men's Basketball Tournament== The 2009 Big East Men's Basketball Tournament, a part of the 2008â09 NCAA Division I men's basketball season, will take place in March 2009 at Madison Square Garden in New York City. This is the first Big East tournament to include all 16 of the conference's teams. Villanova was able to clinch the 4th spot in the Big East, thus earning the double-bye to the quarterfinals in the tournament. {| class="wikitable" ! Date !! Opponent !! Location !! Televised !!
